Why might some antivirus software flag the Verus software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP"?

Some antivirus software, such as Avast and Kaspersky, might flag the Verus software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP" (Potentially Unwanted Program) because it includes mining software, which could potentially be used by a third party to exploit your PC. This is a false positive warning, and you can find more information about it by reviewing the resources provided.

2. (GUI) If a currency is supported in the Verus Desktop already, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use those same named currencies as a PBaaS chain.
